title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0001
text: What is the primary goal of decomposition in microservices architecture?

options.text: To break a monolithic system into smaller, independent services
To increase the number of servers
To reduce the number of APIs
To merge multiple services into one

explanation: Decomposition aims to split a monolithic application into smaller, manageable, and independently deployable services.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0002
text: Which of the following is a common basis for decomposing a system into microservices?
explanation: Decomposition by business capability aligns services with business functions, improving autonomy and scalability.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0003
text: Which principle helps identify service boundaries during decomposition?
explanation: The Single Responsibility Principle ensures each service focuses on one business function or capability.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0004
text: What is a key challenge in decomposing a monolith into microservices?
explanation: Determining appropriate service boundaries is one of the most complex aspects of decomposition.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0005
text: Which decomposition strategy focuses on splitting services based on business domains?
explanation: Decomposition by business capability aligns services with business domains, promoting autonomy and clarity.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0006
text: Which decomposition approach focuses on the data each service owns?
explanation: Decomposition by data ownership ensures each service manages its own data, reducing coupling.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0007
text: Which concept from Domain-Driven Design (DDD) supports microservice decomposition?
explanation: Bounded Context defines clear boundaries for business domains, helping identify microservice boundaries.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0008
text: What is the main advantage of decomposing by business capability?
explanation: Decomposition by business capability ensures services reflect business goals and processes.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a poor decomposition strategy?
explanation: Decomposing by technical layer (e.g., separating UI, logic, and data) leads to tightly coupled services.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0010
text: What is the main risk of decomposing services too finely?
explanation: Over-decomposition leads to excessive inter-service communication and complexity.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of proper decomposition?
explanation: Proper decomposition allows services to be deployed and scaled independently.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0012
text: Which of the following helps avoid tight coupling between services?
explanation: Clear service boundaries ensure loose coupling and independent evolution of services.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a symptom of poor decomposition?
explanation: If changes in one service require changes in others, decomposition boundaries are likely incorrect.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0014
text: Which decomposition approach is guided by user interactions?
explanation: Decomposition by user journey focuses on how users interact with the system to define service boundaries.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0015
text: What is the main purpose of bounded contexts in decomposition?
explanation: Bounded contexts define clear boundaries for domain models, reducing ambiguity and coupling.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a key indicator of good decomposition?
explanation: Good decomposition minimizes inter-service communication, promoting independence.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a common anti-pattern in decomposition?
explanation: Sharing databases between services creates tight coupling and violates service autonomy.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0018
text: Which decomposition approach aligns with Domain-Driven Design?
explanation: Decomposition by subdomain aligns with DDD principles, mapping services to business subdomains.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0019
text: What is the main drawback of decomposing by technical layer?
explanation: Decomposition by technical layer leads to tight coupling and reduced autonomy.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0020
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposition by subdomain?
explanation: Decomposition by subdomain ensures each team owns a specific business area, improving clarity and accountability.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of decomposing by business capability?
explanation: Decomposition by business capability ensures services reflect business goals and processes.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0022
text: What is the main purpose of decomposing a monolith?

options.text: To reduce the number of developers

explanation: Decomposition improves scalability, maintainability, and agility by splitting large systems into smaller services.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a risk of poor decomposition?
explanation: Poor decomposition can lead to tight coupling, making services dependent on each other.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a good indicator of proper decomposition?

options.text: Each service can be deployed independently
All services share the same database
Services depend on each other for every request
All services are managed by one team

explanation: Independent deployment is a key indicator of well-defined service boundaries.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0025
text: Which of the following decomposition strategies is most aligned with Domain-Driven Design?
explanation: Decomposition by subdomain aligns with DDD principles, mapping services to business subdomains.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0026
text: What is the main challenge when decomposing a legacy monolith?
explanation: Identifying appropriate service boundaries is the most complex part of decomposing a legacy monolith.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain?
explanation: Decomposition by subdomain ensures each team owns a specific business area, improving clarity and accountability.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a sign of over-decomposition?

options.text: Too many small services with high communication overhead

explanation: Over-decomposition leads to too many small services, increasing communication overhead and complexity.

explanation: Sharing databases between services creates tight coupling and violates service autonomy.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0030

explanation: Proper decomposition allows services to scale and deploy independently, improving flexibility.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0031

explanation: Clear service boundaries ensure loose coupling and independent evolution of services.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a decomposition anti-pattern?
explanation: Decomposing by technical layer leads to tightly coupled services and poor modularity.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a key principle guiding decomposition?
explanation: High cohesion and low coupling ensure services are focused and independent.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposition by bounded context?

options.text: Clear domain boundaries and reduced ambiguity

explanation: Bounded contexts define clear domain boundaries, reducing ambiguity and coupling.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a sign of under-decomposition?
explanation: Under-decomposition results in large services that handle multiple responsibilities, reducing modularity.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0036
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposition by user journey?
explanation: Decomposition by user journey ensures services align with user interactions and workflows.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0037
text: Which of the following is a key factor in deciding service boundaries?
explanation: Service boundaries should be defined based on business domains and data ownership.

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0038
text: Which of the following is a benefit of proper decomposition?

title: MicroserviceDecomposition - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes microservice decomposition?

The process of merging multiple services into one
The process of centralizing all business logic
The process of sharing databases between services

explanation: Microservice decomposition involves splitting a monolithic system into smaller, independent, and deployable services.
